main event: A letter was sent to the Ground Observer Corps Coordinator for the State of Connecticut, reporting an alleged UFO sighting near Torrington, Connecticut on 5 December 1957. However, there were no military units at the reported location, and the source of the letter was unidentified and considered unreliable.
interesting points: The alleged UFO sighting was reported to the Air Defense Command in accordance with Air Force directives.
The Ground Observer Corps Coordinator and addressees had no knowledge of the author of the enclosed letter, raising doubts about its authenticity.
No military units were found at the reported location in Roseau, Minnesota, prompting a referral to the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

The document includes a request for the eyewitness to describe the object, its altitude, color, shape, direction of flight, and other details, highlighting the efforts to gather information about the sighting.
The letter also assures the witness that the information provided would be held strictly confidential, indicating a level of secrecy and sensitivity around the reported UFO sighting.
